title: Syllabus mentioned in ERP
text: Prerequisites: NoneCourse Contents Why and Where Do Cities Develop: Comparative Advantage, Scale Economics, Agglomerative Economics in Production, the Principle of Median Location, Hub Cities; The Concept of Economic Regions, the Export Base Model, Models of Interregional Trade and Development; Trends in Interregional Income Differentials and Cost Considerations in Interregional Shifts; Theories of Rural-Urban Migration; Economic-Base Theory; System of Cities and the Urban Hierarchy: Central Place Theory and Hierarchy of Central Places, Alfred Webers Theory of Industrial Location, Theory of Agglomerations; Input-Output Analysis; Analysis of Land as a Factor of Production and Different Theories of Economic Rent; the Rent Offer Curve; Urban Land Use, Suburbanization and Commuting; Urban Transportation; the Rank-Size Rule; Optimal City Size - Pollution and Congestion; Reasons for Very Large Cities in Developing Countries; the Relationship Between City Size and the Quality of Life.
